intro: Gyrandra brachycalyx, commonly known as the narrow-calyx gyra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is typically found in sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It is a low-growing shrub that produces small, woody fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
